messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:38): f8405be206fbf30839f25c0e89c8cdf2: we're told that efforts are being made to add more public transparency to the WebGL group but so far nothing tangible seems to have happened

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:40): I have faith that they're eventually going to get around to doing the right thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:41): before or after they're done? </cynic>
f8405be206fbf30839f25c0e89c8cdf2 (10:41): hmm yeah that would be nice indeed...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:42): tries to work out how to register HTTP headers

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:45): Last-Event-ID, Ping-From, Ping-To, WebSocket-Origin, WebSocket-Protocol, WebSocket-Location
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:48): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: is Last-Event-ID a new thing that Opera's impl didn't have?

002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:03): Anyone know if there's any reason why calling DOMImplementation.createDocument with a doctype created by a different implementation doesn't throw in any browser?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:03): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570: not even in IE6 if you create the doctype using the XHR ActiveX thingy?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:04): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570: and offer it to the broweser DOM
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I don't actually have IE6 here
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:04): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570: how do you obtain different DOMImplementations?
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Different documents have different DOMImplementations
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:05): for security reasons?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:05): they wrap the same implementation, though, right?
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:05): Hmnm, maybe that's just Web DOM Core that says that

002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:08): According to zcorpan's copy of Web DOM Core, createDocument with, as the third argument, function(){ var bar = document.implementation.createDocument(null, null, null); return bar.implementation.createDocumentType("bar", "", ""); }() should throw
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:08): I guess I should just ask zcorpan.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:08): Isn't the purpose of DOMImplementation that you can use Xerces and Crimson DOMs in the same app
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:08): but you can't mix their objects without explicit import
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:12): "WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR: Raised if doctype has already been used with a different document or was created from a different implementation." ‚Äî DOM 3 Core
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:12): It doesn't what it means by a "different implementation" though
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:13): How I've always read it is the same as you, and I can't see any way to test a web browser does that.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:14): http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Core/core.html#Embedded-DOM
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:14): hmm, does that mean HTMLDocument should give a different implementation to SVGDocument, for example?

002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (11:16): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: You wouildn't happen to know why Gecko, against spec, throws NAMESPACE_ERR for createElementNS when namespaceURI is not empty and qname is?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:20): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: probably

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (11:42): Sounds like that's how to do the prompting

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:44): should I sort them by offset and assume that the process with a huge offset is the problem?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:56): i'm reading 3864
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:56): but tl;dr
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (11:57): wait, what?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (11:57): ah, registering headers
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:58): there's really no reason the instructions for registering http headers should be longer than 40 or so lines of text
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:58): but the table of contents is about 40 lines!
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (11:58): I skipped to the template myself
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:59): seems wise
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:59): that's what i'm looking at now
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (12:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, Last-ID is new
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:15): http://www.w3.org/2001/tag/2009/10/01-minutes.html is interesting
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:15): removal of document.write() is considered an item up for debate
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:17): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: well, it wouldn't be impossible to remove it from the spec, just foolish
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:18): it would be impossible to remove it from implementations - unclear if that was requested
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:21): we should have a hall of fame for really bad Web platform (mis)features that we are now stuck with forever
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:21): man that would just be depressing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:22): isn't that called "HTML5"?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:22): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: color-coding, man, I'm telling you
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:23): misfeatures in pink
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:23): why would we want to color the whole spec pink?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:23): that would be hard to read
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:23): i'd be hard pressed to find anything that's widely implemented that i couldn't point out fundamental problems with
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:23): even the new stuff like canvas
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:23): DanC is so sensible in those TAG minutes
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:23): I enjoy reading his lines in the minutes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:24): or maybe misfeatures in <blink> would be better
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:25): how about we paint misfeatures in the blood of whoever first implemented them
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:25): wonders how many pints he'd have to donate
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (12:28): Sorry, I'm not allowed to give blood at home.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:33): Noah is very sensible too

6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (12:59): wonders why the TAG spends so much time discussing matters such as document.write(); it's like a decade too late to have an architecture discussion on that

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:06): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: from the minutes, it seems like what they were discussing it in the context of whether it would be worthwhile to have a separate spec that documented HTML processing minus the bad stuff
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:07): You mean an empty document?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:08): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, could publish an empty document
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:08): I think in a better world it would be a great thing
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:09): I wonder why they waste so much time trying to understand HTML5 by brainstorming with each other while a few questions to the HTML WG list would work as well

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:15): indeed, they seem to think it may be valuable to suggest making a separate spec that is a "clean subset", or perhaps just a description in the main spec itself of what such a subset could be
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:15): timbl thought it was as simple as not using document.write() and avoiding implicit <tbody>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:15): it would be interesting to document the intersection of HTML and XML that results in identical processing, but quite challenging
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:16): you fail at <html xmlns
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:16): as someone pointed out recently
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:17): That does seem to be an unusually subtle issue to trap the unwary indeed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:17): I guess there is some value in documenting the intersection that gives the minimum achievable difference between HTML and XML processing
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:23): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: fair enough - it couldn't be identical, it would have to be some definition of "close enough" processing
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:23): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: which would be hard to define in itself
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:23): you'd also have to rule out all use of script if you want the subset to be statically checkable
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:25): e.g. html[xmlns] { background:papayawhip }

8f9c2a2c201a71056a2f9490b0a8d89a (13:27): Is or was there anything in the talks of doing something along the line of <input type="rememberme">? It would be a checkbox, but it would work similar to type="password" where the default behaviour of the UA will fill in i.e., remember me in login forms by default or not

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:28): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: That seems like it is about observability not static checkability

8f9c2a2c201a71056a2f9490b0a8d89a (13:31): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 I guess that'd be it. <input type="checkbox" autocomplete="on">. But autocomplete doesn't appear to apply checkbox. Would this be a good case to do so? The only problem is that, the UA doesn't know it is about 'rememberme'
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:31): I guess I'll proceed to zapping the new menu from V.nu if the Super Friends aren't going to follow up with Sam
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:32): 8f9c2a2c201a71056a2f9490b0a8d89a: it might be worth proposing in a e-mail to one of the mailing lists or through W3C bugzilla
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (13:32): http: doesn't match URI-reference, right?

8f9c2a2c201a71056a2f9490b0a8d89a (13:33): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 Thanks, I could do that, but, I wanted some quick feedback on it before going ahead. There may have been discussions around that already.
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:34): remembering is a UI feature
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:34): autocomplete can be used to turn things off, on is not really a meaningful value
8f9c2a2c201a71056a2f9490b0a8d89a (13:37): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 So, what you are saying is that <input type="checkbox" autocomplete="on"> would be sufficient?
